metadata.Title: CVE-2019-10081 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
HTTP/2 (2.4.20 through 2.4.39) very early pushes, for example configuredwith "H2PushResource", could lead to an overwrite of memory in the pushingrequest's pool, leading to crashes. The memory copied is that of theconfigured push link header values, not data supplied by the client.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-10081` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.10
apache2-bin - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.10
apache2-data - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.10
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.10
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.10
apache2-utils - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.10
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apache2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.29-1ubuntu4.10').
